Dear Harold:
Enclosed is a note which I am sending along
with my Canadian Tax Return for 1959* I was on
the point of mailing rqy Return out when I 1 phoned
the Tax Division stating just what is enclosed
in this letter. Their opinion was that money
paid to me by the NAEB would not be taxable,
since it was from an educational source and paid
to an educator on-leave-of-absence, and to one
who was engaged in educational research. If this
should be their final interpretation it will save
me upwards of $1,000, so here*s hoping.
You might mention to me, Harold, whether a
similar ruling applies to American Taxation of
educational grants.
Spring seems finally to have mosied up this
way, but without any very definite intentions.
Most cordial regards, _ Q
HMM/KN
